item.title: Venus Vacation PRISM: DEAD OR ALIVE Xtreme ‘Rewarding Nonetheless’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/venus-vacation-prism-dead-or-alive-xtreme-rewarding-nonetheless-trailer

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5

Featuring Elise and Tamaki.

Publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Team NINJA have released a new trailer for “immersive romance adventure game” Venus Vacation PRISM: DEAD OR ALIVE Xtreme dubbed “Rewarding Nonetheless.”

Venus Vacation PRISM: DEAD OR ALIVE Xtreme is due out for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam and DMM Games Player on March 27 in Japan and Asia. For PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4, the Japanese release will only support Japanese as a language option, while the Asian release (which the official website labels as the “Global Version”) will support English, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options. The Steam version will also support these language options.

Watch the trailer below.

Short Trailer #2: Rewarding Nonetheless

English

Japanese

Traditional Chinese

item.title: Tides of Annihilation – 11 minutes of gameplay
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/tides-of-annihilation-11-minutes-of-gameplay

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

An extended look at the newly announced fantasy action adventure game.

Eclipse Glow Games has released an 11-minute gameplay video of Tides of Annihilation, its newly announced fantasy action adventure game coming to PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

Here is an overview of the game, via Eclipse Glow Games:

About

Tides of Annihilation is a fantasy action-adventure inspired by Arthurian legend. Uncover the mystery of an otherworldly invasion in a shattered modern London, unleashing hordes of enemies. As Gwendolyn, fight alongside spectral knights to save your family and piece a broken world back together.

Key Features

  • Unveil the Secret of Tides and Piece Together a Broken World – A once-vibrant London has been torn asunder into an eerie reflection of itself—its buildings distorted, lifeforms transformed, and its history shrouded in shadow. Venture into this devastated world to uncover hidden truths and find a way to save your family, city, and the very fabric of reality itself.
  • Harness the Power of Knights and Build Your Order – Experience a unique knightly combat system that allows you to command a band of over ten legendary knights. Inspired by Arthurian lore, each knight brings unique skills and abilities to your team. Combine their powers to craft your own battle strategies, unleashing awe-inspiring cooperative attacks. Forge a path to victory with your personalized Order of Knights.
  • Encounter and Conquer Colossal Knights – Towering like mountains, the colossal knights roaming Greater London are more than mere set pieces—they are integral to your journey. Engage in epic battles against these mighty giants, scale their massive forms, and delve into their palatial depths and uncover the grand tales that define their existence.

Watch the footage below.

11 Minutes of Gameplay

item.title: Ys Memoire: Memories of Celceta for Switch launches May 22 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/ys-memoire-memories-of-celceta-for-switch-launches-may-22-in-japan

  • Switch

Currently available for PlayStation 4, PS Vita, and PC.

Ys Memoire: Memories of Celceta, the official title of the recently announced Switch version of Ys: Memories of Celceta, will launch on May 22 in Japan for 4,840 yen, Falcom announced.

Ys: Memories of Celceta is currently available for PlayStation 4, PC via Steam, and PS Vita.

Get the first details below.

About

The action RPG series Ys has received high praise from players worldwide for its simple yet exhilarating battles, clear and dramatic storylines, and intense background music that elevates the combat experience.

Ys: Memories of Celceta, which originally released for PS Vita in 2012 and set the systems groundwork for Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of DANA and Ys IX: Monstrum Nox, has now been enhanced with high-definition remastering and new features as Ys Memoire: Memories of Celceta for Nintendo Switch.

New Features

  • Newly Arranged Versions of All In-Game Background Music – You can freely switch between the beloved original tracks and their newly arranged versions at any time, allowing both first-time players and returning fans to enjoy the story and battles of Ys: Memories of Celceta anew.

Story Prologue

Casnan, a city on the Romun frontier, is in the midst of a gold rush. Among the miners and workers, a red-haired young man wanders through the crowd. He accidentally bumps into a rowdy miner, who picks a fight and strikes him hard.

“What is this place?… Who am I…?”

Just after the young man mutters this, someone suddenly calls out…

“Hey, Adol! Is that you?”

The person calling out was a tall, muscular man with silver hair. Naturally, the young man did not recognize him. Despite his appearance, the man was surprisingly familiar and overly friendly, introducing himself as Duren, an informant.

According to Duren, the young man’s name is Adol Christin. A few weeks earlier, Adol had met Duren in the city, then traveled to the Great Forest of Celceta, a place that even the locals rarely enter, and since then, his whereabouts had been unknown.

What happened to Adol in the Great Forest of Celceta, also known as the devil’s domain? Why did he lose all his memories?

To uncover the truth, Adol decides to once again venture into the forbidden land of the Great Forest of Celceta, this time with Duren…

Reversible Box Art

The physical edition of Ys Memoire: Memories of Celceta includes reversible box art featuring the original artwork from the PS Vita version.

Physical Edition First-Print Bonus: Original Soundtrack

First-print copies of the Ys Memoire: Memories of Celceta physical edition will include a two-disc original soundtrack with all of the newly arranged background music from the game. The CD case features exclusive original artwork.

(There are no plans to sell this soundtrack separately.)

10 Percent Off Digital Pre-Orders

Once digital pre-orders for Ys Memoire: Memories of Celceta open, users will be able to pre-order the game at 10 percent off the retail price.

Visit the official website here. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯

item.title: Horgihugh and Friends coming to PC in late February
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/horgihugh-and-friends-coming-to-pc-in-late-february

  • PC

Shoot 'em up currently available for Switch.

Mebius will release a PC version of PiXEL-developed side-scrolling shoot ’em up Horgihugh and Friends via Steam in late February for 1,980 yen, the developer announced. It will be available at a 30 percent-off discount price of 1,386 yen for the first two weeks of release. It will support English and Japanese language options.

Horgihugh and Friends, also known as Horgihugh and Friends in Japan, first launched for Switch on June 3, 2021 in Japan, followed by June 16, 2022.

Here is an overview of the game, via Switch version western publisher Aksys Games:

About

Shoot down 16-bit bad guys in Horgihugh and Friends!

At the end of a brutal war, countries decided to dismantle their weapons. When the Gozareans attack, two retired pilots realize their trusty vintage fighter planes are the only means of combating the alien’s powerful weapon-nullifying technologies. Taking to the skies, Hugh and Figaro are the world’s last wings of hope.

Feature points:

  • A horizontal side-scrolling shooter featuring vibrant retro graphics and an adorable cast of animal characters.
  • Six challenging stages, 13 intense boss battles, two difficulty levels, and a unique power-up system to explore.
  • Take control of two pilots at the same time, since you’ll need all the help you can get.
  • Featuring artwork by Kou (Mega Man 2X, Shantae) and music by Motoaki Furukawa (Gradius II, Metal Gear, Policenauts).

item.title: Mobile Suit Gundam SEED: Battle Destiny Remastered announced for Switch, PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/mobile-suit-gundam-seed-battle-destiny-remastered-announced-for-switch-pc

  • PC
  • Switch

Due out on May 22.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer B.B. Studio have announced Mobile Suit Gundam SEED: Battle Destiny Remastered for Switch and PC (Steam). It will launch on May 22 worldwide.

Mobile Suit Gundam Seed: Battle Destiny Remastered is a remastered version of the PS Vita game Mobile Suit Gundam SEED: Battle Destiny, which was released only in Japan on June 7, 2012.

Here is an overview of the game, via Bandai Namco:

About

Become a pilot in the world of Mobile Suit Gundam SEED, for the first time available with English localization! Engage in thrilling, action-packed Gundam battles, complete missions, and tune up your newly acquired Mobile Suits!

Key Features

  • Battle Across Turbulent Times! – Relive legendary moments from Mobile Suit Gundam SEED and Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny with enhanced maps and graphics. Choose your faction from Earth Alliance Forces, ZAFT, or the Archangel, and complete missions alongside familiar pilots and Mobile Suits from the series.
  • Over 100 Mobile Suits! – All Mobile Suits have been redesigned with high-resolution model textures. Unlock more Mobile Suits and missions from the main Mobile Suit Gundam SEED series, and battle into additional side stories from the Mobile Suit Gundam SEED universe.
  • Tune Up Your Suits! – Strengthen your suits and weaponry in the redesigned UI menu. Tune your suits to match your playstyle as you embark on missions and take on stronger opponents!
  • System Enhancements – New lock-on modes and controller settings have been added for smoother gameplay.

*Product is based on Mobile Suit Gundam SEED: Battle Destiny released in 2012. Some specifications may differ.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Announce Trailer

English

Japanese

Screenshots
